conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to understand the particle's motion considering symmetry and periodicity.

The image shows a velocity-time graph with a dashed vertical line indicating symmetry. The graph is a parabola, opening downward, with the vertex at the origin. The time interval from 0 to t1 is marked.
The symmetry about the dashed line suggests that if the velocity at time t is v, then the velocity at time -t is -v, implying periodic motion with a period of 2t1.
The particle's motion repeats every 2t1 seconds, so any event in one period will repeat in the next period.
The particle passes through a certain position three times in the interval 0 to t1, implying the position changes three times in this interval.
If the particle moves with constant velocity within 0 to t1, it will pass through a certain position three times.
If the particle has periodic acceleration, it can pass through a certain position three times due to the symmetry and periodic nature of the graph.
The possible scenarios for the particle's motion include constant velocity or periodic acceleration, allowing it to pass through a certain position three times within the time interval 0 to t1.
